channel.title: Symbols and Minimap
channel.description: Ok I got a simple question, Im looking for a symbol on the mini map. It always finds it but there 2 of the same symbols, one to the right and one to the left of the mini map. How do I make it so that it ignors the one on the left and only performe the command I give it to on the symbol to the right? Is this even possible?

item.title: Symbols and Minimap
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Yea, you could do that, too.

Read full topic

item.title: Symbols and Minimap
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

couldnt you make a simple “if x < x1 then” statement and if you want to use the left one make it look for the smaller value and if you wanted to use the right one make it look for the larger value

Read full topic

@M0rtion wrote:

i dont know, but good luck on al ka rid silk buyer lol?hes looking for the water icon except theres a fountain in the palace aswell

Read full topic

item.title: Symbols and Minimap
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Well, I think GetSymbolColor ( Which is used in FindSymbol ) uses FindBitmapSpiral… when it looks for the the symbol bitmap, so before you call the FindSymbol function, set x and y to coordinates that fall right by or a little to the right of the symbol you’re looking for, that way it’ll find it first, but, I’m not sure if that would work.

The next option would be to modify FindSymbol, just get the bitmap of the symbol your looking for from the GetSymbolColor function and use the same FindBitmap function used there, but set the box coordinates ( Coordinates to look in for the the bitmap ) to exclude the area where the symbol on the left would be.

Read full topic
